_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Ten grounds of harmony in the Saṅgha [an: Explaining what is not the teaching as not the teaching
Explaining what is the teaching as the teaching
Explaining what is not the training as not the training
Explaining what is the training as the training
Explaining what was not spoken and stated by the Realized One as not spoken and stated by the Realized One
Explaining what was spoken and stated by the Realized One as spoken and stated by the Realized One
Explaining what was not practiced by the Realized One as not practiced by the Realized One
Explaining what was practiced by the Realized One as practiced by the Realized One
Explaining what was not prescribed by the Realized One as not prescribed by the Realized One
Explaining what was prescribed by the Realized One as prescribed by the Realized One.
Results of creating harmony in a schisma: Rejoicing in heaven for an eon.
